levels.name: Create a variable
levels.description: Create a variable with the name a and assign it to the value 10

help.text: Variables are used to store data values.
help.code: x = 5 //with this line of code, the value 5 is assigned to x.

levels.name: Sum of two numbers
levels.description: Create a variable called x and assign it the sum of 10 and 15

help.text: When assigning to a variable, you can also use arithmetic expressions, such as +, -, /, *.
help.code:
x = 10 - 5; //this would first calculate 10 - 5 and then assign it to x;
 y = 20 / 2;

levels.name: Other arithmetics
levels.description: Create a variable x and assign it the 10 * 15

levels.name: Sum two variables
levels.description: Assign to a variable 'c', the sum of the variables 'a' and 'b'

help.text: You can also use variables in the assignment of new or current variables.
help.code:
x = y; // this line would assign the value of y to x.
x = y / z; // this would assign the result of y / z to x.

levels.name: Increment and decrement
levels.description: Increment the value of x by 10

help.text: You are able to reuse the current value in an assignment.
help.code:
x = x + 1; //increments the current value of x by 1.
x -= 2; //would decrease the value of x by 2

levels.name: Strings
levels.description: Create a string variable called test, containing the string "Hello World"

help.text: Strings are used to store texts. They have to be created within ""
help.code: testString = "This is a typical string, it contain any characters, and also numbers."

levels.name: Characters
levels.description: Create a variable z containing only the character z

help.text: Characters are used to store only single characters. They have to be created with ''

levels.name: Mixing data types
levels.description: Assign to a variable z concatenated value of x and y.

help.text: When trying to add numbers to strings, they are just concatenated to the string.
help.code: a = "Hello world" + 2; //the value of a is now "Hello world2"
